result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessica S VanDaalen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber and Huber homemaker privileges granted.
Credit for 7 days if revoked.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must report to Probation by 3:00 p.m. on November 30, 2015.

miscConds.notes:
$250.00 cash bond posted in this case and $500.00 cash bond posted in 15CM362 to be applied towards Court costs.
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must maintain absolute sobriety.
Must continue AODA counseling at Vantage Point Clinic as long as counselor recommends it.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessica S VanDaalen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
(clerked by SM)
Defendant Jessica S VanDaalen in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM362, 15CM413, 15CM285 & 15CM158

15CM158, 15CM362, 15CM413 - Court dismisses and reads-in.

15CM285 - Court questions Defendant.  Defendant pleads guilty to count 1.  Court accepts and finds guilty.
Argument by State.
Argument by Attorney Raymond.
Defendant addresses Court.

Court relates and orders:
Impose and stay 60 days jail with huber and huber/homemaker.  Credit for 7 days.  
Probation - 1 year.  Must check in at probation on November 30, 2015 at 3:00 PM.
Continue AODA counseling at Vantage Point Clinic as long as counselor recommends it.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Any other assessments or programming per agent.
Costs

All bond money posted in any case is to be applied to costs per agreement of defendant.

Order to Submit DNA Specimen form given to Defendant.  To report December 1, 2015 between 1 - 5 pm.

(clerked by RW)
Defendant Jessica S VanDaalen in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Russell E Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CM285 & 15CM413. 
Defense requests the daily PBT condition on both bonds be removed. State relates. Court relates and orders the bonds be modified to change the PBT time from 6:00 PM to 6:00 AM.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must not have abusive contact with Michael H. 
Must submit to daily PBTs at the Rice Lake Police Department at 6:00 PM.

10-27-2015 - Bond modified as follows: Change time for PBT from 6:00 PM to 6:00 AM

All other conditions to remain in full force and effect
